title: Diapause interuption of a life cycle 1

content.question: Which of the following best describes the reproductive ability of C. elegans following the <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mtext>ARD</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaeyqaiaabkfacaqGebaaaa@3854@</annotation> </semantics> </math> induced in the first experiment?

choices.label: Mating with a well-fed male consistently produced more offspring than did reproduction via self-fertilization.
The numbers of progeny produced by self-fertilization and by mating with well-fed males were not statistically different.
C. elegans stopped reproducing after 20 days without food.
There was no relationship between days without food and average brood size.

content.answer: Mating with a well-fed male consistently produced more offspring than did reproduction via self-fertilization.
